# Discord Chat Analysis for ðŸ’»â”‚developers

## 1. Summary:
The chat primarily focused on technical discussions around Hyperfy development. Key topics included vector field types in app configurations, a chess application with world storage bugs, AI model integration, and teleportation functionality. Ash mentioned that vec3 field types exist for app transforms but aren't yet exposed to config, suggesting modifications to Sidebar.js and Fields.js to implement this. Gh0stt shared a chess application (pre.chess.numen.games) that has some world storage bugs. There was discussion about AI integration, with Ash clarifying that AI functionality is available in the dev branch with environment variables that enable features like generating objects via chat commands (e.g., "/create a chair"). Several users requested help with teleportation functionality and PDF uploads. The conversation also briefly touched on new AI models, with references to external discussions on Twitter.

## 2. FAQ:
Q: How to input text in hyp instead of chat box? (asked by å¤ªé˜³) A: Unanswered
Q: What other flags exist?! (asked by .hyp shaman) A: Unanswered
Q: Can you help me insert the portal in my space? I can't figure out how to set the arrival point. (asked by Nicola Bertoglio) A: This should help: https://github.com/hyperfy-xyz/hyperfy/blob/dev/docs/scripting/app/Props.md (answered by .hyp shaman)
Q: Do we have any hyp to upload pdf? (asked by Cayden0207) A: Unanswered

## 3. Help Interactions:
Helper: ash | Helpee: Cayden0207 | Context: Setting up AI functionality in self-hosted environment | Resolution: Ash explained that AI features are in the dev branch with environment variables for AI integration, allowing object generation via chat commands
Helper: Gert-Jan Akerboom | Helpee: Nicola Bertoglio | Context: Needed an app for teleport functionality | Resolution: Directed to check the all.hyps channel for teleport apps in V2
Helper: .hyp shaman | Helpee: Nicola Bertoglio | Context: Setting up portal with arrival point | Resolution: Provided documentation link to Props.md in the Hyperfy GitHub repository

## 4. Action Items:
Technical: Add vec3 field type exposure to config in Sidebar.js and Fields.js | Description: Implement vec3 field type that's currently used for app transforms but not exposed to config | Mentioned By: ash
Technical: Fix world storage bug in chess application | Description: Address persistent issues with world storage in the chess app | Mentioned By: Gh0stt
Feature: PDF upload functionality | Description: Create or identify a hyp for uploading PDF files | Mentioned By: Cayden0207
Technical: Implement AI integration from dev branch | Description: Set up environment variables for AI functionality that enables object generation via chat commands | Mentioned By: ash

# Discord Chat Analysis for "ðŸ¤–â”‚agents" Channel

## 1. Summary
The chat segment is very brief and contains minimal technical discussion. Fibelius shared resources about Hyperfy agents, including a HackMD document about agentic game behavior and links to Hyperfy documentation. They noted that the demo page (agents.hyperfy.xyz) was not working, but suggested looking at examples on play.hyperfy.xyz. Ash confirmed that the agents world is offline. A user named å¤ªé˜³ asked about alternative ways to add AI to their world but received no response. Finally, Fibelius shared a link to a Twitter post about a system prompt for GPT-5 Codex. Overall, the channel appears to be relatively inactive with limited substantive technical discussion.

## 2. FAQ
Q: Is there any other way to add some AI to your world? (asked by å¤ªé˜³) A: Unanswered

## 3. Help Interactions

## 4. Action Items

# Analysis of ðŸ§Šâ”‚3d-design Channel

## 1. Summary
The chat segment in the 3d-design channel contains minimal technical discussion. The main topics include:

- Questions about non-technical users building their own "vibe coded universe" in HyperWorld
- Requests for API key support in hosted worlds
- A user sharing their new HyperWorld host (akerboom.hyperworld.host)
- Confirmation from HypPrivakos that API key support is in progress
- A question about text input in Hyp outside of the chat box
- Several image or link shares by .hyp shaman without accompanying text context

The conversation suggests that HyperWorld.Host is working on allowing users to add their own API keys to their hosted worlds, which appears to be a requested feature. There was minimal detailed technical discussion or problem-solving in this segment.

# Analysis of Discord Chat in ðŸª™â”‚hyper Channel

## 1. Summary
The chat segment is very brief and focuses on a question about the AI prompting feature in what appears to be a self-hosted environment. A user named Cayden0207 inquires if the prompting feature has been released and is available in production environments. Gert-Jan Akerboom confirms it's included in the latest development version. When Cayden follows up about using it in production on Hostinger and Railway hosting services, ash redirects the conversation to a different channel (#994775534733115412) for a more detailed response.

## 2. FAQ
